questions.question: A district has 10,24,000 inhabitants. If the population increases at the rate of 2.5% per annum, find the number of inhabitants at the end of three years.
Which of the following is the least?

In an examination, 35% students failed in one subject and 42% failed in another subject, while 15% failed in both the subjects. If 2500 students appeared at the examination, how many passed in only one subject?
If 80% of the students in a school are boys and the number of girls is 160, what is the total number of students in the school?
In a survey, it was found that in a constituency, 55% of voters are male and the rest are female. 40% of the male voters are illiterate and 40% of what percentage of female voters are literate?
A man spends 75% of his income. If his income increases by 20% and his expenditure increases by 10%, then find his percentage increase in savings.
In a class of 130 students, 60 passed in Physics, 70 passed in Chemistry, and 30 passed in both. How many students failed in both subjects?
The virus count in a culture decreases by 5% per hour. If the count is initially 2.3 x 10^7, find the count after 24 hours.

In a national level examination, 47% of students received 61-80% marks, 23% received 81-100% marks, and the remaining 30% received 41-60% marks. If 195 students received 41-60% marks, how many students took the examination?
The price of a computer is ₹22,200. What will be the price after a 25% reduction?
